name: Ability Checks
description: An ability check tests a character’s or monster’s innate talent and training to overcome a challenge. The DM calls for an ability check when a character attempts an action that has a chance of failure. The outcome is determined by rolling a d20 and adding the relevant ability modifier.

name: Saving Throws
description: A saving throw—also called a save—represents an attempt to resist a spell, a trap, a poison, a disease, or a similar threat. To make a saving throw, roll a d20 and add the appropriate ability modifier.

name: Attack Rolls
description: When you make an attack, your attack roll determines whether the attack hits or misses. To make an attack roll, roll a d20 and add the appropriate modifiers.

name: Armor Class
description: Armor Class (AC) represents how well your character avoids being wounded in battle. Your AC is determined by your armor, shield, and Dexterity modifier.

name: Initiative
description: Initiative determines the order of turns during combat. Each participant rolls a d20 and adds their Dexterity modifier.

name: Movement
description: On your turn, you can move a distance up to your speed. You can break up your movement before and after actions.

name: Actions in Combat
description: During your turn, you can take one action. Common actions include Attack, Cast a Spell, Dash, Disengage, Dodge, Help, Hide, Ready, Search, and Use an Object.

name: Bonus Actions
description: Certain features, spells, and abilities allow you to take an additional action on your turn called a bonus action.

name: Reactions
description: A reaction is an instant response to a trigger, which can occur on your turn or someone else’s. The most common reaction is an opportunity attack.

name: Hit Points
description: Hit points (HP) represent a combination of physical and mental durability, the will to live, and luck. When you take damage, you subtract it from your hit points.

name: Resting
description: Resting allows characters to regain hit points and resources. A short rest is at least 1 hour long, while a long rest is at least 8 hours long.

name: Death Saving Throws
description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points and not killed outright, you must make death saving throws to determine whether you live or die.

name: Proficiency Bonus
description: Your proficiency bonus applies to attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks for which you are proficient.

name: Spellcasting
description: Spellcasting is the ability to cast spells, which are magical effects. Each class has its own rules for spellcasting.

name: Advantage and Disadvantage
description: When you have advantage, you roll two d20s and use the higher roll. When you have disadvantage, you roll two d20s and use the lower roll.

name: Cover
description: Cover represents obstacles between an attacker and a target. A target behind cover has a bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws.

name: Conditions
description: Conditions alter a creature’s capabilities in a variety of ways and can arise as a result of a spell, a class feature, a monster’s attack, or other effect.

name: Exhaustion
description: Exhaustion is measured in six levels. Each level adds cumulative effects, and reaching the sixth level results in death.
